intro: [WRONG START] Rodrigezia satipoana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
